api/BOOSEUnitTest.Test1.html.title: Class Test1 | My Project Docs
api/BOOSEUnitTest.Test1.html.summary: Class Test1 Unit tests for the AppCanvas class. This class verifies the coordinate tracking, drawing commands, and state management of the custom BOOSE canvas implementation. Inheritance object Test1 Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Namespace: BOOSEUnitTest Assembly: BOOSEUnitTest.dll Syntax [TestClass] public sealed class Test1 Methods DrawTo() Tests that the canvas moves its drawing position to the specified coordinates when DrawTo is called. Declaration [TestMethod("C:\\Users\\ellio\\source\\repos\\ase-boose-assignment-RainbowSlime818\\BOOSEapp\\BOOSEUnitTest\\Test1.cs", 40)] public void DrawTo() Remarks Verifies that after invoking DrawTo with given x and y values, the canvas's position properties reflect the new coordinates. This test ensures correct behavior of the DrawTo method in updating the canvas state. MoveTo() Tests that the MoveTo method correctly updates the canvas position to the specified coordinates. Declaration [TestMethod("C:\\Users\\ellio\\source\\repos\\ase-boose-assignment-RainbowSlime818\\BOOSEapp\\BOOSEUnitTest\\Test1.cs", 64)] public void MoveTo() Remarks Verifies that after calling MoveTo with given x and y values, the canvas's Xpos and Ypos properties reflect the new position. This test ensures the MoveTo method functions as expected when moving the canvas. MultiMove() Verifies that multiple move and draw operations on the canvas update its position as expected. Declaration [TestMethod("C:\\Users\\ellio\\source\\repos\\ase-boose-assignment-RainbowSlime818\\BOOSEapp\\BOOSEUnitTest\\Test1.cs", 87)] public void MultiMove() Remarks This test method checks the correctness of the canvas's position after performing a sequence of MoveTo and DrawTo operations. It ensures that the canvas's X and Y coordinates reflect the intended values after each operation. Setup() Initializes resources before each test method is run. Creates a fresh 1000x1000 AppCanvas instance to ensure tests do not interfere with each other. Declaration [TestInitialize] public void Setup()

api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | My Project Docs
api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas A specific implementation of the BOOSE ICanvas interface. This class uses GDI+ (System.Drawing) to perform graphical operations on a Bitmap surface. Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Namespace: BOOSEapp Assembly: BOOSEapp.dll Syntax public class AppCanvas : ICanvas Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class with the specified canvas dimensions. Declaration public AppCanvas(int width, int height) Parameters Type Name Description int width The width, in pixels, of the canvas to create. Must be greater than zero. int height The height, in pixels, of the canvas to create. Must be greater than zero. Properties PenColour Gets or sets the color used for drawing operations with the pen. Declaration public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value Type Description object Xpos Gets or sets the horizontal position value. Declaration public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value Type Description int Ypos Gets or sets the vertical position value. Declaration public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value Type Description int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle with the specified radius at the current position, optionally filled or outlined. Declaration public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters Type Name Description int radius The radius of the circle, in pixels. Must be a non-negative value. bool filled A value indicating whether the circle should be filled (true) or only outlined (false). Clear() Clears the drawing surface and fills it with a white background. Declaration public void Clear() Remarks Use this method to reset the graphics surface before starting a new drawing operation. All existing content will be removed and replaced with a solid white fill. DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current position to the specified coordinates and updates the current position to the new point. Declaration public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters Type Name Description int x The x-coordinate of the destination point to which the line will be drawn. int y The y-coordinate of the destination point to which the line will be drawn. Remarks After drawing the line, the current position is set to the specified coordinates. Subsequent drawing operations will start from this new position. MoveTo(int, int) Sets the object's position to the specified X and Y coordinates. Declaration public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters Type Name Description int x The new horizontal position, in units, to move the object to. int y The new vertical position, in units, to move the object to. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle at the current position with the specified width and height. Declaration public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters Type Name Description int width The width, in pixels, of the rectangle to draw. Must be greater than zero. int height The height, in pixels, of the rectangle to draw. Must be greater than zero. bool filled Indicates whether the rectangle should be filled (true) or only its outline should be drawn (false). Reset() Resets the pen position to the default starting coordinates. Declaration public void Reset() Remarks After calling this method, the pen position is set to the top-left corner. Use this method to reinitialize the drawing position before starting a new drawing operation. Set(int, int) Sets the dimensions using the specified width and height values. Declaration public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters Type Name Description int width The width value to set. Must be a non-negative integer. int height The height value to set. Must be a non-negative integer. Exceptions Type Condition NotImplementedException Thrown in all cases as the method is not yet implemented. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the color of the pen using the specified red, green, and blue component values. Declaration public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters Type Name Description int red The red component of the color. Must be an integer between 0 and 255, inclusive. int green The green component of the color. Must be an integer between 0 and 255, inclusive. int blue The blue component of the color. Must be an integer between 0 and 255, inclusive. Tri(int, int) Draws a triangle shape with the specified width and height. Declaration public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters Type Name Description int width The width of the triangle, in pixels. Must be a positive integer. int height The height of the triangle, in pixels. Must be a positive integer. Exceptions Type Condition NotImplementedException Always thrown, as this method is not yet implemented. WriteText(string) Writes the specified text to the output destination. Declaration public void WriteText(string text) Parameters Type Name Description string text The text to write. If null or empty, no content will be written. Exceptions Type Condition NotImplementedException Thrown in all cases as the method is not yet implemented. getBitmap() Returns the current bitmap associated with the canvas. Declaration public object getBitmap() Returns Type Description object An object representing the canvas bitmap. The specific type and contents depend on the implementation. Implements BOOSE.ICanvas

api/BOOSEapp.Form1.html.title: Class Form1 | My Project Docs
api/BOOSEapp.Form1.html.summary: Class Form1 The main entry form for the BOOSE application. This form handles the user interface for the BOOSE drawing application and initializes the BOOSE components. (Canvas, Factory, Parser, Program), and updates the display. IBindableComponent, IComponent, IDisposable, IContainerControl Constructors Form1() Initializes a new instance of the Form1 class and sets up the application's main components and event handlers. Declaration public Form1() Remarks This constructor configures the drawing canvas, command factory, stored program, and parser required for the application's functionality. It also attaches the Draw button's click event handler. Use this constructor to create and initialize the main form for the application. Methods Dispose(bool) Clean up any resources being used. Declaration protected override void Dispose(bool disposing) Parameters Type Name Description bool disposing true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false. api/BOOSEapp.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEapp Classes AppCanvas A specific implementation of the BOOSE ICanvas interface. This class uses GDI+ (System.Drawing) to perform graphical operations on a Bitmap surface. Form1 The main entry form for the BOOSE application. This form handles the user interface for the BOOSE drawing application and initializes the BOOSE components. (Canvas, Factory, Parser, Program), and updates the display.
